top10_tweets_like: Just learned an amazing #rstats trick: You can embed #learnr apps using `knitr::include_app()` for live coding demos *inside* #xaringan slides! ü§Ø This way you don't have to switch b/w slides and #rstudio IDE for live demos, reducing cognitive load. #rmarkdown knows no bounds! ü§© https://t.co/WAYxyKoWLd

One of the best #rstats workflow tips I‚Äôve encountered and then adopted was naming R Markdown chunks after the most important object that‚Äôs created in them, e.g.

```{r sampled_letters}
sampled_letters <- sample(letters)
```

Have you ever wanted to use R's colors in your {xaringan} slides or other R Markdown HTML docs? (Yes, this tweet is for a very niche #rstats audience.) 

If you said YES! then I've put together some CSS files just for you
https://t.co/mZaS4fYKsa
